title: Payment Providers
text: This is the section where you set up the payment provider to be used in TOP and POP. Please note that payments for Kiosk and Simple POS are set up in Admin since they use the Connector. To get started, choose the desired payment provider from the drop-down list, which can be either Valitor or OB Pay. Depending on the selected provider, you will be asked to fill in specific fields. Key This is the API Key provided to us by Valitor. Private Key This is provided by Valitor. Name This is the name of the payment integration, provided by Valitor. Is Production Environment This switches configuration to be in test or production mode. OB Pay is the provider used for GlobalPay as the Payment Acquirer and can be used worldwide. Payment Provider Config Client ID This is provided to K3 by OB Pay. Shared Secret Saved This is provided to K3 by OB Pay. It is obfuscated at entry, the check mark shows the shared secret has been entered correctly and saved. NOTE: If OB Pay provides a new key the Set New Shared Secret button can be used to apply the new key. Once applied, the field will say Shared Secret Saved and the check mark will be shown. Account This is the account name provided by OB Pay. Use Production Environment Switches configuration between test and production mode. Payment Methods Merchant Country Code Required for Google Pay accounts if shown. Enable Apple Pay Choose On if Apple Pay is to be accepted Apple Pay Merchant Identifier Enter this here for Apple Pay. Enable Google Pay Choose On if Google Pay is to be accepted. Google Pay Merchant ID Required if Google Pay is accepted. This must be set up in conjunction with an OB Pay account, Google Pay is provided via the OB Pay account. Enter the Merchant Id for Google Pay her Click Save when complete. Apple Pay Payment Method Configuration Follow the on-screen steps to complete the Apple Pay set-up.

title: Payment Icon Settings
text: The Payment Icon Settings feature in the SCO (Self Serve) application offers users configurable options to control the visibility of payment type logos on the initial splash screen. It also allows users to display custom icons as per their preference. Default Payments Icons The Payment Icon Settings feature in the SCO (Self Serve) application provides a default set of card schemes that are displayed on the initial splash screen. Users can utilize toggle buttons to control the visibility of specific icons, either showing them (On) or hiding them (Off). By default, all icons are initially set to On. Please note that the icon URLs are predefined within the system and cannot be modified, as well as the list of default card schemes. Remember to click Save in order to apply any changes made. Custom Payment Icons "If any card schemes are not displayed in the Default Payment Icons list, you can add them here. Utilize the Add Payment Icon section to create new payment icons. Once a payment icon is created, use the toggle buttons to control its visibility, either showing it (On) or hiding it (Off). If you wish to remove a specific card payment icon permanently, you can click on the adjacent Delete button." Please note that this revised version maintains the original meaning while providing a clearer and more concise explanation. Add Payment Icon To add payment icons to the Custom Payment Icons section, follow these steps: Enter the name of the payment icon (required). Provide the Icon URL (required) for the payment icon. Click the "Add Payment Type Icon" button to add the payment icon to the custom list. By following these steps, you can successfully add a payment icon to the custom list in the application.

The Payment Icon Settings feature in the SCO (Self Serve) application offers users configurable options to control the visibility of payment type logos on the initial splash screen. It also allows users to display custom icons as per their preference.




Default Payments Icons

The Payment Icon Settings feature in the SCO (Self Serve) application provides a default set of card schemes that are displayed on the initial splash screen. Users can utilize toggle buttons to control the visibility of specific icons, either showing them (On) or hiding them (Off). By default, all icons are initially set to On.


Please note that the icon URLs are predefined within the system and cannot be modified, as well as the list of default card schemes.


Remember to click Save in order to apply any changes made.


Custom Payment Icons

"If any card schemes are not displayed in the Default Payment Icons list, you can add them here. Utilize the Add Payment Icon section to create new payment icons.


Once a payment icon is created, use the toggle buttons to control its visibility, either showing it (On) or hiding it (Off).


If you wish to remove a specific card payment icon permanently, you can click on the adjacent Delete button."


Please note that this revised version maintains the original meaning while providing a clearer and more concise explanation.


Add Payment Icon

To add payment icons to the Custom Payment Icons section, follow these steps:


Enter the name of the payment icon (required).

Provide the Icon URL (required) for the payment icon.

Click the "Add Payment Type Icon" button to add the payment icon to the custom list.

By following these steps, you can successfully add a payment icon to the custom list in the application.

title: Stripe Setup for TOP
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Introduction Stripe Details Secret Key Webhook Secret TOP Setup Setup Complete Introduction This article describes the setup process for implementing Stripe as the payment solution for TOP. This article assumes a Stripe account has already been set up as is out of scope of K3 services. Note, there is a minimum transaction amount of 30pence with Stripe, so it is important to note this when testing the setup. Stripe Details In order to configure TOP, we need to key pieces of information from within the Stripe dashboard of the retailer. Secret Key Webhook Secret (Which requires a webhook to be setup) Secret Key Once logged in, Click the Developers button in the topbar of the dashboard. Click the API Keys tab, and then reveal secret key. It is this secret key we need as part of the setup. Webhook Secret In order to obtain a webhook secret, you need to create a webhook. The Webhook receives notifications back from Stripe to indicate that transactions are successful. Click the Webhooks tab, still within the Developers section and Add an Endpoint Enter the endpoint URL first. For production setups this is https://portal.k3imagine.com/ms-stripe/api/v1.0/Webhook. Then press Select Events wich allows us to choose what events they will send to our webhook. Scroll down and expand the Checkout section and enable checkout.session.complete. Click Add Events and then Add Endpoint and you'll see the webhook details. Reveal the signing secret and make a note of it, as we need that for the TOP setup. The Stripe setup is now complete. TOP Setup In the Imagine Portal, go to Self Serve Admin > Payment Providers. Select Stripe and enter the secret key and webhook secret you obtained above. Setup Complete The setup is finished. You should now have Stripe as your payment provider in TOP.
description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • Introduction
  • Stripe Details
    • Secret Key
    • Webhook Secret
  • TOP Setup
  • Setup Complete

Introduction

This article describes the setup process for implementing Stripe as the payment solution for TOP.


This article assumes a Stripe account has already been set up as is out of scope of K3 services.


Note, there is a minimum transaction amount of 30pence with Stripe, so it is important to note this when testing the setup.


Stripe Details

In order to configure TOP, we need to key pieces of information from within the Stripe dashboard of the retailer.

  • Secret Key
  • Webhook Secret (Which requires a webhook to be setup)


Secret Key

Once logged in, Click the Developers button in the topbar of the dashboard.


Click the API Keys tab, and then reveal secret key. It is this secret key we need as part of the setup.



Webhook Secret

In order to obtain a webhook secret, you need to create a webhook. The Webhook receives notifications back from Stripe to indicate that transactions are successful.


Click the Webhooks tab, still within the Developers section and Add an Endpoint


Enter the endpoint URL first. For production setups this is https://portal.k3imagine.com/ms-stripe/api/v1.0/Webhook. Then press Select Events wich allows us to choose what events they will send to our webhook.

Scroll down and expand the Checkout section and enable checkout.session.complete.


Click Add Events and then Add Endpoint and you'll see the webhook details.


Reveal the signing secret and make a note of it, as we need that for the TOP setup.



The Stripe setup is now complete.


TOP Setup

In the Imagine Portal, go to Self Serve Admin > Payment Providers.


Select Stripe and enter the secret key and webhook secret you obtained above.


Setup Complete

The setup is finished. You should now have Stripe as your payment provider in TOP.

title: Refunds for TOP Transactions Using Stripe
text: When using TOP, there are scenarios where you may need to issue a refund. As Stripe is our preferred payment provider for TOP, we have extended our integration to allow you to refund transactions from within Imagine. In Self Serve Admin > Shops Choose your Shop from the list, and there is a new tab for Stripe Refunds This shows you a filterable list of transactions that have been processsed through Stripe. It also shows you the Stripe Payment intent ID so you can cross reference the payment to the Stripe Dashboard. You will see there are 2 columns. Transaction Amount (The amount the original transaction was for) and Refunded Amount which is how much for that transaction has been refunded. This is a good visual indicator of any refunds you have had to process. When you have identified the transaction to refund, press the Arrow for it. You will see an itemised list of refunds applied to that transaction if any exist. Otherwise, enter the amount you want to refund into the box and press Refund. At this point the refund will be charged back to the customer on the card they originally paid with, and they will be emailed with a receipt from Imagine advising them of the refund. You'll get a toaster notification to advise its been successful. Reviewing the transaction with the refund applied will show the successful refund.

When using TOP, there are scenarios where you may need to issue a refund. As Stripe is our preferred payment provider for TOP, we have extended our integration to allow you to refund transactions from within Imagine.


In Self Serve Admin > Shops


Choose your Shop from the list, and there is a new tab for Stripe Refunds



This shows you a filterable list of transactions that have been processsed through Stripe. It also shows you the Stripe Payment intent ID so you can cross reference the payment to the Stripe Dashboard.


You will see there are 2 columns. Transaction Amount (The amount the original transaction was for) and Refunded Amount which is how much for that transaction has been refunded. This is a good visual indicator of any refunds you have had to process.



When you have identified the transaction to refund, press the Arrow for it.



You will see an itemised list of refunds applied to that transaction if any exist.



 Otherwise, enter the amount you want to refund into the box and press Refund.


At this point the refund will be charged back to the customer on the card they originally paid with, and they will be emailed with a receipt from Imagine advising them of the refund. You'll get a toaster notification to advise its been successful.



Reviewing the transaction with the refund applied will show the successful refund.
